definition: to review (a lesson etc)
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
surname Wen
(bound form) to practice/to study/habit/custom
surname Xi

sentences.english: I have taken physical exercise; now I must go at my lesson.
sentences.chinese: 我已经体育锻炼过了，现在得温习功课。

sentences.english: He wants to furbish up his French.
sentences.chinese: 他要温习一下他的法语。

sentences.english: I possibly even helped the children in the neighbourhood with their lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我帮他们干农活，扶助邻家的孩子温习功课。

sentences.english: Tom was watching TV while Jim was reviewing his lessons.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆在看电视，而吉姆在温习功课。

sentences.english: It is critical those you absorbing exert for the exam or you will fail it.
sentences.chinese: 为了考好你必需用功温习，则你会不及格的。

sentences.english: A silver watch in a leather case to wear on my wrist and get me to recitations on time.
sentences.chinese: 一只装在皮盒子的银手表，可以让我准时温习功课。

sentences.english: She is reviewing her lessons in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 她正在教室里温习功课。

sentences.english: Revise properly, otherwise you won't pass your exams.
sentences.chinese: 好好温习功课，否则考试通不过。

sentences.english: I’ve have to go over my notes for tomorrow’s talk.
sentences.chinese: 我得为了明天的讲话温习一下我笔记。

sentences.english: He looked through his notes before the final examination.
sentences.chinese: 他期末考试前温习了自己的笔记。

sentences.english: I should have listened to you. I should have started studying earlier.
sentences.chinese: 我应该老早听你们的，应该早一点开始温习。

sentences.english: I'll have to hit the books to  prepare for the finals.
sentences.chinese: 我得温习功课准备期末考试了。

sentences.english: I often go over my exercise books for revision.
sentences.chinese: 我经常翻阅习作簿來温习。

sentences.english: He gave his Spanish a brush-up .
sentences.chinese: 他温习了一下西班牙语。

sentences.english: Brush up your skills by taking a course.
sentences.chinese: 通过学习课程来温习你的技能。

sentences.english: Remind them of it at least once a year.
sentences.chinese: 提醒他们至少一年温习一次。

definition: to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
to prepare a lesson
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to review/revision/CL:次[ci4]
to make a deeper impression on sb
to get a better grasp of sth
to recite/to repeat from memory
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
one time (all the way through)/once through
to browse/to look over (books)
to recall/to recollect/to think back
to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
to copy/to transcribe
to learn by heart/to memorize
